titleStmt.title: William T. Samuels to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4855

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Auditor's Office, Kentucky.
WILLIAM T. SAMUELS,
Attorney at Law & General Collecting Agent,
FRANKFORT, KY.
&#9758 Special attention given to collection of all claims confided to him throughout the State of Kentucky.
WILLIAM T. SAMUELS, Auditor.
EDGAR KENNON, Ass't Auditor.
James M. Withrow, Clerk.
Uberto Keenon, Clerk.
R. R. Bacon, Clerk.
John A Crittenden, Clerk.
Jno. W. Pruett, Jr., Clerk.
Charles T. Miller, Clerk.
John L. Sneed.Frankfort, Ky., April 8, 1864.
Hon Thos E Bramlette
Gov of Ky
Dear Sir

Thos E Edwards Sheriff of Green Co for 1861 this day paid Bal on revenue due from said co for said year together with interest & cost and now praise your Excellency to be relieved from the payment of $71525 this being the amount of damages adjudged against him for the non payment of the Revenue and from said Co for said year in time as required by Law
